input_text:
Job Title: Logistics Specialist

Location: Anchorage, AK

Employment Type: full-time

Listed Skills: Management, Manufacturing

Description:
Daily Activities Will Include

 Day-to-Day tasking from and support to the Willow Logistics Manager and Logistics Planner Liaison with other personnel and contractors in support of Willow objectives. Provide specialist level support for scheduling, transportation and staging of project construction materials. Troubleshooting and support to logistics service contractors as needed Responding to dynamic changes during construction activities Inspection and receipt of materials as required. Preparation of any required reports Leading or supporting any investigations into logistics or material related concerns.

HSE

 Proactively lead HSE performance by communicating, fostering, supporting, and enforcing HSE policies procedures, guidelines, requirements, and objectives Perform HSE engagements and interventions with contracted service providers if required Implement and support the Incident Free Culture (IFC) program with contractors through participation in IFC workshops and field engagements Continuously demonstrates strong adherence to Company SPIRIT values

Qualification Requirements

Basic / Required:

 5+ years oil and gas experience to include Greenfields/brownfields major project construction Current/valid driverâ€™s license Willing and able (with or without reasonable accommodation) to travel several days at a time.

Preferred

 5+ years direct logistics related experience on the North Slope or elsewhere in Alaska Knowledge of existing North Slope operating practices and contract relationships Experience with SAP material tracking and receiving Advanced level interpersonal, written, and verbal communication skills Advanced level multi-tasking skills with ability to manage multiple ongoing activities Demonstrated ability to work collaboratively within a team and across organizational boundaries Ability to synthesize data and develop suitable quantitative models to support logistics strategies and planning. Drives thoughtful and pragmatic change, encourages innovative thinking and continuous improvement Models adaptability through resourcefulness, flexibility, and positivity

With over 90 years' combined experience, NES Fircroft (NES) is proud to be the world's leading engineering staffing provider spanning the Oil & Gas, Power & Renewables, Chemicals, Construction & Infrastructure, Life Sciences, Mining and Manufacturing sectors worldwide. With more than 80 offices in 45 countries, we are able to provide our clients with the engineering and technical expertise they need, wherever and whenever it is needed. We offer contractors far more than a traditional recruitment service, supporting with everything from securing visas and work permits, to providing market-leading benefits packages and accommodation, ensuring they are safely and compliantly able to support our clients.

Experience Level (if available): Entry level

output_json.title: Logistics Specialist
